Description: A string of long and standard cylindrical beads of blue-black glazed composition and two smaller cylinders of light-blue-green, large, thin, barrel disc beads of Prussian-blue glazed composition, five light-blue glazed composition spherical beads with flattened sides and two long cylinders of bone.
Curator's comments: Also from this burial: shells (1930,0711.211). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 115; Tomb register, pl.LXX; Bead register, pl.LXXIA.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (596)
